action.action-desc: Mr. Raskin (for himself, Ms. Norton, Ms. Wasserman Schultz, Mr. DeFazio, Ms. Jayapal, Mr. Johnson of Georgia, Ms. Michelle Lujan Grisham of New Mexico, Mr. Foster, Ms. Jackson Lee, Mr. Grijalva, Mr. Khanna, Mr. Nadler, and Mr. Cooper) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on the Judiciary

form.official-title: To prohibit the transfer of a firearm to a person whose State license to purchase, own, or possess a firearm has been revoked, or a person who has been ordered by a State court to surrender all firearms.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the State Access to Firearms Evading Revocation Act.

section.header: Prohibition on transfer of firearm to person whose State license to purchase, own, or possess a firearm has been revoked or who has been ordered by a State court to surrender all firearms
section.text: Section 922(d) of title 18, United States Code, is amended in the 1st sentenceâ€”

paragraph.text: by striking or at the end of paragraph (8);
by striking the period at the end of paragraph (9); and
by adding at the end the following:

subparagraph.text: has had a license or permit, issued by a State in which the person has resided that allows the person to purchase, own, or possess a firearm, revoked by the State, and has not had the license or permit reinstated; or
has been ordered by a court of such a State to surrender all firearms owned or possessed by the person, and has not had the firearms lawfully returned.
